textos_fuente.text: Florida Festival Wristband Info | Reggae Rise Up Reggae Rise Up Merch Contact Events Select Market Florida Arizona Maryland Oregon Utah Vegas Reggae Rise Up Florida FL HOME FL Concerts Festival Lineup Past Lineups Festival Tickets 2026 Festival Tickets 2026 Vacation Packages Festival Info Info & FAQs The Experience RRU Festival App Get Involved CRAFT VENDORS FOOD VENDORS FL Contact Menu ▼ Festival Tickets Vacation Packages Reggae Rise Up Florida Festival Wristband Info Only wristbands marked for 2025 will grant access to Reggae Rise Up Florida Festival 2025. All purchases are for Reggae Rise Up 2025, not a specific artist. All Shipped Orders will be sent to the address on file. REMINDER: All International Orders are WILL CALL-Only. If you need support for your Tixr ticket order, please email support@tixr.com . If you need support for a Vacation Package order, please contact wegotyou@jampackexperiences.com. Wristband Support If you purchased a WILL CALL ticket type, wristbands must be picked up at the Festival Box Office. All wristbands are associated with the name of the original order purchaser. Only the person whose name is on the order may receive direct support for wristbands. Our team can only offer support to the order holder for ticket orders purchased through our official ticketing partner (Tixr). If you are picking up wristbands at the box office, please remember your order Confirmation Email and a Valid Government-Issued ID. Your wristband must remain on your wrist at all times during the festival. Wristband replacement fee is $20. BOX OFFICE HOURS 2025 Box Office Hours Thursday, March 13th – Sunday, March 16th 11:00AM – 9:30PM Main Box Office is located on the SW side of the park, closer to Downtown St. Petersburg on 5th Avenue. VIP Box Office is located on the NW side of the park at the intersection of 7th Ave and Bayshore Dr. For any questions, wristband swaps, or to purchase any remaining wristbands, plea se se e our amazing Box Office staff. Wristband 101 Don’t put your wristband on until you’re on your way to the festival. Wristbands can’t be removed or loosened once you put them on. Only wristbands purchased through Tixr or Authorized Retailers are valid. Wristbands are Non-Transferable and Non-Exchangeable Reggae Rise Up Florida • Arizona • Maryland • Oregon • Utah • Vegas • © Reggae Rise Up 2025. website by: Fighting Fifth Web

Florida Festival Info | Reggae Rise Up Reggae Rise Up Merch Contact Events Select Market Florida Arizona Maryland Oregon Utah Vegas Reggae Rise Up Florida FL HOME FL Concerts Festival Lineup Past Lineups Festival Tickets 2026 Festival Tickets 2026 Vacation Packages Festival Info Info & FAQs The Experience RRU Festival App Get Involved CRAFT VENDORS FOOD VENDORS FL Contact Menu ▼ Festival Tickets Vacation Packages Upcoming Concerts Reggae Rise Up Florida Festival Info Thursday, March 12th Gates Open – 4:00PM Friday, March 13th Gates Open – 12:00PM Saturday, March 14th Gates Open – 12:00PM Sunday, March 15th Gates Open – 12:00PM All amplified music must end by 10:00PM each night per city ordinance. ENTRY CANS AND CAN’TS Allowed Items List Chairs Poster Tubes Regular-sized or unframed backpacks Empty, refillable plastic or aluminum bottles, & Camelbak’s Sealed water up to 1L Binoculars Bags & Strollers are allowed but will be searched thoroughly Cigarettes and E-Cigarettes Deodorant, Sunscreen & Non-Aerosol bug spray Hula Hoops Personal Umbrellas only, anything larger than an umbrella that accommodates 2 people will not be allowed Good Vibes *All items are subject to search and the Prohibited Items List is subject to change.* Prohibited Items List Outside food or beverage items Alcohol or Flasks Ice or Ice packs Blankets or Towels Coolers Glass Containers Illegal substances, drugs, or drug paraphernalia Any of these items that are deemed unsafe or inappropriate, or are being used for purposes other than intended, may be confiscated on-site Illegal or unauthorized vending Knives or weapons of any kind Professional photo, video, or audio recording devices without prior approval Drones, UAVs, or UFOs Lasers or light pointers Animals or pets (except registered service animals that assist people with disabilities, please contact us in advance) Flammable lanterns or fire of any kind Fireworks or any types of explosives Skateboards, scooters or personalize motor vehicles Bicycles inside the festival grounds Tents or canopies Wagons or carts of any type Chains, chain wallets, or spiked jewelry Instruments, megaphones, horns, or noisemakers Soliciting Pepper spray Spray paint, large markers Bad Vibes (Dad Vibes okay!) 2025 BOX OFFICE HOURS 2026 Box Office Hours Coming Soon Main Box Office is located on the SW side of the park, closer to Downtown St. Petersburg on 5th Avenue. VIP Box Office is located on the NW side of the park at the intersection of 7th Ave and Bayshore Dr. For any questions , wristband swaps, or to purchase any remaining wristbands, please see our amazing Box Office staff . FACILITIES Medical : The Reggae Rise Up medical team will be on-site to address any type of medical problem you may have. The medical tent will be located between the main festival grounds and the vendor village. If you need assistance go to the medical tent, locate security, or a festival staff member. Security : Our primary goal is to create a safe and secure environment for everyone in attendance. To ensure this, there will be on-site security provided by our private security staff and local police. If any problems occur whatsoever, locate a festival security guard, police officer, or festival staff member. Food : Reggae Rise Up’s Vendor Village will offer a variety of food options from several local food trucks/vendors. We will have vegetarian/vegan options as well. More detailed information will be released as the festival becomes closer. Bars : For our 21+ attendees we will have several beer options throughout the festival grounds with your favorite domestics, imports, and local brews. In addition, we will have multiple bars with full liquor options. Bathrooms & Handwashing Stations : Bathrooms and hand washing stations will be placed throughout the festival site. We ask that you help us in keeping them as clean as possible for the next festival attendee. Information / Lost & Found : Stop by for any and all information you need related to Reggae Rise Up Florida. Here you can find festival maps & guides, drop off or find a lost item, set times, etc. Vendors : Vendor Village will feature local retail vendors offering a wide selection of items like clothing, accessories, craft items, tech products, and more. Festival and artist merchandise will also be located in the vendor village. FAQs WHAT ARE THE HOURS OF THE FESTIVAL? Thursday, March 12th Gates Open – 4:00PM Friday, March 13th Gates Open – 12:00PM Saturday, March 14th Gates Open – 12:00PM Sunday, March 15th Gates Open – 12:00PM All amplified music must end by 10:00PM each night per city ordinance. When is the Festival Box Office Open? 2026 Box Office Hours Coming Soon. Main Box Office is located on the SW side of the park, closer to Downtown St. Petersburg on 5th Avenue. VIP Box Office is located on the NW side of the park at the intersection of 7th Ave and Bayshore Dr. For any questions , wristband swaps, or to purchase any remaining wristbands, please see our amazing Box Office staff . WHAT IF IT RAINS, CAN I GET A REFUND? No, this festival is rain or shine! All Sales Final, No Refunds. WILL TICKET PRICES INCREASE? Yes, tickets will increase as inventory is sold through, and as we get closer to the festival dates. We always recommend purchasing in advance to save the most money. Tickets are also often SOLD OUT ahead of the festival, so lock in the good vibes now! WILL THERE BE FOOD & ALCOHOL AT THE FESTIVAL? Yes! There will be a great variety of food vendors plus an increased number of beer trailers along with a more full alcohol bars. WILL THERE BE ADA ACCOMMODATIONS? We want to provide an unforgettable experience for everybody at the Reggae Rise Up Florida Festival. Please refer to the festival map to to guide you where to enter on 7th Ave and use ADA compliant restrooms. Additional questions please email Info@ReggaeRiseUp.com This event was designed to provide equal opportunity for enjoyment by all participants. If you would like to request any particular aids or services pursuant to disability laws , please contact the event planner  at 801.419.0858 or City of St Petersburg Community Affairs Division at (727) 893-7345 or (727) 892-5259 TDD/TTY. (Please only call the city of St. Pete about ADA related questions) Are pets or emotional support animals allowed in the festival? No, we do not allow pets or emotional support animals. However, registered service dogs are permitted to enter the event in accordance with ADA guidelines. If you need clarification on whether your dog qualifies as a service animal, please refer to the first section of the Service Animal FAQs on ADA.gov . To complete a Service Animal Registration Request, please notify Reggae Rise Up of your service animal’s attendance and your need for assistance during the festival. ARE WE ALLOWED TO BRING FOOD, WATER & ALCOHOL? There is no outside food or alcohol allowed into the festival, but you are able to bring in one (1) sealed water bottle up to 1L in size or an empty reusable personal water bottle. We will have plenty of food options from local vendors for you to choose from. We also have a FREE water refill station available. Please note that all items will be subject to search upon arrival. I’M A PHOTOGRAPHER. CAN I COME TAKE PICTURES? To apply for a media pass please click the “Get Involved” Tab and Select ” Media Application” when available. WHAT CAN I NOT BRING? Allo wed Items List Chairs Poster Tubes Regular-sized or unframed backpacks Empty, refillable plastic or aluminum bottles, & Camelbak’s Sealed water up to 1L Binoculars Bags & Strollers are allowed but will be searched thoroughly Cigarettes and E-Cigarettes Deodorant, Sunscreen & Non-Aerosol bug spray Hula Hoops Personal Umbrellas only, anything larger than an umbrella that accommodates 2 people will not be allowed Good Vibes *All items are subject to search and the Prohibited Items List is subject to change.* Prohibited Items List Outside food or beverage items Alcohol or Flasks Ice or Ice packs Blankets or Towels Coolers Glass Containers Illegal substances, drugs, or drug paraphernalia Any of these items that are deemed unsafe or inappropriate, or are being used for purposes other than intended, may be confiscated on-site Illegal or unauthorized vending Knives or weapons of any kind Professional photo, video, or audio recording devices without prior approval Drones, UAVs, or UFOs Lasers or light pointers Animals or pets (except registered service animals that assist people with disabilities, please contact us in advance) Flammable lanterns or fire of any kind Fireworks or any types of explosives Skateboards, scooters or personalize motor vehicles Bicycles inside the festival grounds Tents or canopies Wagons or carts of any type Chains, chain wallets, or spiked jewelry Instruments, megaphones, horns, or noisemakers Soliciting Pepper spray Spray paint, large markers Bad Vibes (Dad Vibes okay!) ARE WE ALLOWED TO BRING SOME FESTIVAL SPIRIT? 100%. Festival Totems, Flags, Signs, accepted and encouraged. CAN I BRING MY KIDS? Absolutely! We welcome families of all ages. Kids 6 and under are also free. Strollers for children are permitted but expect them to be searched. WHAT CAN I BRING TO SIT DOWN & STAY IN THE SHADE? D ue to safety concerns, space, and viewing concerns, we kindly ask you to leave blankets, tents, and canopies at home. You CAN bring chairs along with small personal umbrellas. *For 2026 we will have designated chair areas at each stage. No chairs in front of the sound/lighting booth (Front Of House). WILL THERE BE FIRST AID ON SITE? Of course, we have a dedicated medical tent with several professional EMT units to help when needed. WHERE CAN I FIND THE FLYER TO SHARE WITH FRIENDS? Visit us at any of our social media accounts FB : @ReggaeRiseUpFlorida IG : @ReggaeRiseUp_Florida TW : @ReggaeRiseUp TikTok : @ReggaeRiseUp RRU YouTube | RRU Spotify WILL THERE BE RE-ENTRY? YES, we allow a one (1) time re-entry if the attendee leaves anytime before 6:00 PM. You must scan your RFID wristband out before 6:00 PM to be valid. After 6:00 PM it will be on a case-by-case basis, please see security or the manager at the front gate. 2025 Festival Hours Coming Soon. WHERE CAN I FIND PERFORMANCE TIMES? 2026 Schedule Coming Soon WHAT ACTIVITIES WILL BE HAPPENING DURING THE FESTIVAL? Music, Vendors, Games, Sports, Crafts, Art, Relaxation Stations, Fan Interactions and more! WHEN DOES THE EVENT END EACH DAY? Music ends at 10 PM each night due to city ordinance, so please arrive early to experience all the amazing bands. …But the party never stops in St. Pete! Stay tuned for Afterparty Info closer to the Festival Dates. ARE THERE ANY OTHER TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS? The St. Petersburg City Trolley will be running a route between the festival and the Sundial parking garage. Seats are extremely limited. More info at www.StPeteTrolley.com . I WANT TO HELP VOLUNTEER DURING THE FESTIVAL, WHAT DO I DO? Fill out the form when you click Volunteers under the ‘Get Involved’ tab on the website. If you have more questions please email us at RRUStaffing@gmail.com for more details. I LOVE REGGAE AND WANT TO HELP PROMOTE BEFORE THE FESTIVAL, WHAT DO I DO? Please email us at Info@ReggaeRiseUp.com for more details. I NEED HELP WITH MY ORDER! WHO SHOULD I TALK TO? Please see our Wristband Info Page Here SHARE YOUR STOKE Reggae Rise Up Florida • Arizona • Maryland • Oregon • Utah • Vegas • © Reggae Rise Up 2025. website by: Fighting Fifth Web

Reggae Rise Up Florida 2025: Good Food, Great Vibes & Even Better Music - RootfireRootfire Rootfire ABOUT CONCERT CALENDAR LISTEN Reggae Release Radar Progressive Roots Playlist A Conversation In Dub Rootfire Select Playlist Rootfire Rewind The Reggae PodClash MIXTAPES INTERVIEWS EDITORIAL ALBUM SHOWCASE Artist Spotlight Reggae Release Radar First Listen Women in Reggae Throwback Thursday Roots Record Showcase Editor’s Note Two On The Mic A Photo Is Worth 1000 Songs COOPERATIVE Overview Man-Like-Devin – Wheel And Shulder: Acoustic Reggae, Rocksteady & Ska Vol. 1 Steel Pulse – Mass Manipulation The Elovaters – Defy Gravity For Peace Band – Always Love The Expanders – Blood Morning Thunder Body – Solstice Nattali Rize – Rebel Frequency Satsang – Pyramid(s) The Holdup – Leaves In The Pool Giant Panda Guerilla Dub Squad – Make It Better HIRIE – Wandering Soul The Movement – Golden SHOP DONATE Start Rootfire Radio powered by Spotify Nothing happening? Download Spotify (free) Stationhead Rootfire: Progressive Roots Reggae Rise Up Florida 2025: Good Food, Great Vibes & Even Better Music By Stephan on Mar 30, 2025 
		• Vinoy Park in St. Petersburg once again became the national mecca of reggae music, this time celebrating the 10th anniversary of Reggae Rise Up Florida. Fans eagerly awaited the opening of the gates, the start of the music, and an all-time high in vibes. With over 50 acts throughout the weekend, headlined by legends Sting & Shaggy, Slightly Stoopid, Rebelution, and Dirty Heads, fans from across the country were in for an experience they would cherish for a long time. Personally, this was my first Rise Up festival in any location. For years, friends have told me this is the place to be for someone who loves this scene as much as I do. While I always believed them—and suffered from serious FOMO—it never lined up for me. But this year, fresh off a very Stoopid time in Mexico, back in the freezing temps of New Jersey where my wife and I live, and with an all-too-familiar foe, Mr. Seasonal Depression , breathing down our necks, we knew we had to book the trip. Spoiler alert: we made the right decision. The Arrival Stepping out of our Uber on the first day, we were immediately hit with a buzz of excitement. The streets, blocked off by police for the festival, were filled with smiling faces. A familiar medicinal scent lingered in the air, outfits were colorful and fun, and you could hear live music in the distance for the entire walk to the gates. The energy was palpable, and judging by the look on everyone’s faces, we weren’t the only ones feeling it. As soon as you step through the gates, you’re greeted by art and food—is there a better duo? Huge murals lined the perimeter, painted by incredible artists, some of whom were still putting on the finishing touches. I got a chance to chat with a few of them, and they were just as proud to be there as the musicians we came to see. Next, you walk through rows of vendors selling everything from food to clothing to incense—all operated by some of the friendliest people I’ve met in a long time. Just like the artists, they were truly grateful to be part of the event. There was plenty of great food, but special shoutout to Get BAKED Stuffed Pretzel Rolls – I’m a pretzel junkie, and their Philly cheesesteak-stuffed soft pretzel hit the spot. Dirty Heads Slightly Stoopid The Headliners Each night’s headliner delivered exactly what you’d expect—an incredible, larger-than-life set. Seeing Sting & Shaggy perform together was a dream come true. As a lifelong Police fan, hearing Sting’s voice in person was pure magic. Slightly Stoopid ran through all the fan-favorite jams and even brought out Matisyahu and Chali 2na (The Verbal Herman Munster). A fireworks show kicked off Rebelution ’s set during “De-Stress,” leading into everyone’s favorite “WHOA OH OH OH OH OHHH” moment. What followed was what has become the norm—a perfect set that sounded like a studio recording come to life. To close out the weekend, Dirty Heads brought insane energy to the Rise Up Stage. ROME came out for “Lay Me Down,” Jared and Duddy sounded phenomenal, and the crowd never stopped dancing and rapping along from start to finish. Kabaka Pyramid The Elovaters Aurorawave Standout Performances While the headliners drew the biggest crowds, many acts stole the weekend . If you ask a hundred people their favorite set, you might get a hundred different answers. That’s the beauty of festivals. The Elovaters had one of the most talked-about sets of the weekend. Bumpin Uglies turned their set into a full-on party, which I watched get rowdier by the second from the raised bleacher section. Aurorawave melted faces with heavy reggae, introducing many fans (myself included) to their live magic for the first time. Kabaka Pyramid gave us an amazing performance of his Grammy winning album. The Sub Herbs had their local fans out early, jamming. Pepper almost caused an earthquake with the energy they brought. Kyle Smith brought punk to the park. DENM had a sound issue, but what followed was incredible—the crowd sang “Find Your Own Way” word for word , creating a live music memory I’ll never forget. Tropidelic went so hard, they literally brought a storm in. (Seriously. It caused a delay in the performances.) Tropidelic Kyle Smith After a full festival evacuation and a couple-hour delay, the crowd was reenergized. As soon as the gates reopened, The Movement got things started again like nothing had happened. The set was so fun, even Rootfire’s Director ended up inside an inflatable ball, getting passed around by the crowd. Throughout the weekend, Sugarshack —a Rise Up Florida staple at this point—gave us incredible acoustic performances on their own stage. Some of which were Bombargo , Sensamotion , SOJA , Vana Liya , Dale and the ZDubs , and ROME . And if you had any energy left after the festival, the after-parties each night with Mihali , Bikini Trill , Surfer Girl , Bumpin Uglies , and Passafire at The Floridian were wild . Curious to receive some feedback from other attendees, I asked people what their favorite part of the festival was: “Meeting new friends who share the same love for reggae music. So refreshing.” — Gabriel from Utah, by way of Honduras “Rebelution’s set was awesome! I was not expecting fireworks at all!” — Daniel B. from Fort Myers, FL “Definitely the people I met! And Dan Kelly fist-bumping me on stage!” — Josh W. from Quincy, IL “The music and the peeps!” — Lawrence M. from San Antonio, TX “Meeting Kyle Smith and seeing Rebelution. Also, meeting a StickSister in person!” — Stephanie N. from Dunnellon, FL Room for Improvement Were there a few hiccups? Sure—but with a festival of this magnitude, in Florida’s unpredictable climate, that’s inevitable. While the overall experience was great and the good far outweighed the bad, there were a few issues worth mentioning: Sound issues: Several bands had technical difficulties, and while that happens, it shouldn’t be a consistent problem. Overcrowding: Some larger sets and the Sugarshack Stage were nearly impossible to navigate. Rail viewing confusion: GA had to look from behind GA+, VIP had to look from behind VIP Platinum—it felt like a logistical issue that could have a better solution. Litter: This one’s on us as festivalgoers. Yes, big events get messy, but let’s do better at respecting the beautiful park that welcomes us back every year That said, the positive vibes prevailed, and hopefully, constructive criticism is heard so next decade can be even better. When it was all said and done, we had an amazing time. We saw so many friends we only see once or twice a year, met countless new ones, and experienced some of the best reggae music in the world. This may have been our first Rise Up, but something tells me it won’t be our last . Point Break Festival Join us June 21-22 for the premier reggae rock festival of the mid-Atlantic! 4.5 2 votes Article Rating Share this: Tweet Email More Print Share on Tumblr Reddit Pocket Related Stephan Writer Stephan has been obsessed with music for as long as he can remember. From the first time he heard Billy Joel, the sharp punchlines of Beastie Boys, reggae’s laid-back rhythms, to the electric energy of a live show, music has shaped his life in every way. Music journalism isn’t just a gig—it’s a passion. Nothing makes him happier than putting deserving bands in front of bigger audiences, giving them the recognition they’ve earned. Whether he’s at a concert, digging into a new album, or growing The Reggae Plug, he’s always chasing that next great sound. When he’s not immersed in music, you’ll find him traveling, watching sports, or planning his dream restaurant—always with a soundtrack playing in the background. Vegas Wristband Info | Reggae Rise Up Reggae Rise Up Merch Contact Events Select Market Florida Arizona Maryland Oregon Utah Vegas Reggae Rise Up Vegas VEGAS HOME Vegas Concerts Festival Lineup 2025 Festival Lineup Past Lineups Festival Tickets Festival Tickets Vacation Packages GOVX DISCOUNT Festival Info Festival Info & FAQs Wristband Info The Experience Mobile Charging Lockers RRU Festival App Get Involved Street Team Craft Vendors Food Vendors Media Become An Ambassador Contact Holo Holo Festival Menu ▼ Festival Tickets Vacation Packages Upcoming Concerts Reggae Rise Up Vegas Festival Wristband Info Only wristbands marked for 2025 will grant access to Reggae Rise Up Vegas Festival 2025. All purchases are for Reggae Rise Up 2025, not a specific artist. All Shipped Orders (NON-WILL CALL Ticket Types) will be sent to the address on file. If you have moved from the address you provided, please stop by the Festival Box Office for support. REMINDER: All International Orders are WILL CALL-Only. If you need support for your Event Live ticket order, please email support@eventliveus.com . If you need support for a Vacation Package order, please contact wegotyou@jampack.com . Wristband Support If you purchased or received a WILL CALL ticket type, wristbands must be picked up at the Festival Box Office. Wristbands are linked to the current name on the order, and only that person can receive direct support. To pick up your wristbands, please remember your confirmation email and a valid government-issued ID. Our team can only offer support to the order holder for ticket orders purchased through our official ticketing partners (Event Live & Jampack). Your wristband must remain on your wrist at all times during the festival. Wristband replacement fee is $20, and support is available at the Festival Box Office. 2025 BOX OFFICE HOURS 2025 Box Office Hours Thursday, October 2nd – 4:00PM – 9:00PM Friday, October 3rd – 11:00AM -­ 10:00PM Saturday, October 4th – Saturday 11:00AM -­ 10:00PM Sunday, October 5th – 11:00AM – 10:00PM Box Office Location 298 E Carson Avenue Las Vegas, NV 89101 For any questions, wristband swaps, or to purchase any remaining wristbands, please see our amazing Box Office staff. Wristband 101 Don’t put your wristband on until you’re on your way to the festival. Wristbands can’t be removed or loosened once you put them on. Only wristbands purchased through Event Live or Jampack are valid. Wristbands are Non-Transferable and Non-Exchangeable SHARE YOUR STOKE Reggae Rise Up Florida • Arizona • Maryland • Oregon • Utah • Vegas • © Reggae Rise Up 2025. website by: Fighting Fifth Web

Oregon Festival Info | Reggae Rise Up Reggae Rise Up Merch Contact Events Select Market Florida Arizona Maryland Oregon Utah Vegas Reggae Rise Up Oregon OREGON HOME FESTIVAL LINEUP FESTIVAL TICKETS FESTIVAL INFO FESTIVAL INFO & FAQS CAMPING INFO & FAQS THE EXPERIENCE THINGS TO DO FESTIVAL MERCH GET INVOLVED BECOME AN AMBASSADOR OR CONTACT Menu ▼ Purchase Tickets Vacation Packages RSVP To The Event Reggae Rise Up Oregon Festival Info Friday, August 29, 2025 Gates Open – 12:00 pm – 11:30 pm Saturday, August 30, 2025 Gates Open – 12:00 pm – 11:30 pm Sunday, August 31, 2025 Gates Open – 12:00 pm – 11:00 pm All amplified music will end at 11:30 pm on Friday and Saturday. Amplified music will end at 11:00 pm on Sunday. CAMPING & FESTIVAL TICKETS SOLD SEPARATELY FESTIVAL GROUNDS ENTRY CANS AND CAN’TS Allowed Items List Blankets Chairs Regular-sized or unframed backpacks that will be searched upon entry Empty, refillable plastic or aluminum bottles, & Camelbak’s Sealed water up to 1L Binoculars Poster Tubes Diaper bags & strollers are allowed but will be searched thoroughly and must be used as intended Deodorant, Sunscreen & Non-Aerosol bug spray Hula Hoops Portable battery packs Personal misting fans with a bottle no larger than 1.5 L – must be empty upon entry Personal umbrellas only, anything larger than an umbrella that accommodates 2 people will not be allowed Personal prescription medicines with a matching name on verified ID Good Vibes *All items are subject to search and the Prohibited Items List is subject to change.* Prohibited Items List Outside food or beverage items Alcohol or flasks Cigarettes, tobacco or E-cigarettes – Deschutes County Fair & Expo Center is a tobacco-free and smoke-free facility. Ice or ice packs Coolers Glass containers Illegal substances, drugs, or drug paraphernalia Any items that are deemed unsafe or inappropriate, or are being used for purposes other than intended, may be confiscated on-site Illegal or unauthorized vending Knives or weapons of any kind Professional photo, video, or audio recording devices without prior approval Drones, UAVs, or UFOs Lasers or light pointers Animals or pets (except registered service animals that assist people with disabilities, please contact us in advance) Flammable lanterns or fire of any kind Fireworks or any types of explosives Skateboards, scooters or personalized motor vehicles Bicycles inside the festival grounds Tents or canopies Hammocks Frisbees or sports balls Wagons or carts of any type Chains, chain wallets, or spiked jewelry Instruments, megaphones, horns, or noisemakers Soliciting Pepper spray Spray paint, large markers Bad Vibes (Dad Vibes okay!) 2025 BOX OFFICE HOURS 2025 Box Office Hours Thursday, August 28th – 2:00 pm – 10:00 pm Friday, August 29th – 8:00 am – 10:00 pm Saturday, August 30th – 9:00 am – 10:00 pm Sunday, August 31st – 9:00 am – 10:00 pm The Box Office is located at the Northeast Entrance into the Festival Grounds, referred to as the Main Entrance on the Festival Map, adjacent to the Oregon State University Extension Service (Map Coordinates: 44.2379649,-121.1823944). There will be temporary parking available at the Festival Box Office. For any questions, wristband swaps, or to purchase any remaining wristbands, please see our amazing Box Office staff. FACILITIES Medical: The Reggae Rise Up medical team will be on-site to address any type of medical problem you may have. If you need assistance go to the medical tent, locate security, or a festival staff member. Security: Our primary goal is to create a safe and secure environment for everyone in attendance. To ensure this, there will be on-site security provided by our private security staff and local police. If any problems occur whatsoever, locate a festival security guard, police officer, or festival staff member. Food: Reggae Rise Up’s Vendor Village will offer a variety of food options from several local food trucks/vendors. We will have vegetarian/vegan options as well. More detailed information will be released as the festival becomes closer. Bars: For our 21+ attendees we will have several beer options throughout the festival grounds with your favorite domestics, imports, and local brews. In addition, we will have multiple bars with full liquor options. Bathrooms & Handwashing Stations: Bathrooms and hand washing stations will be placed throughout the festival site. We ask that you help us in keeping them as clean as possible for the next festival attendee. Information / Lost & Found: Stop by for any and all information you need related to Reggae Rise Up Oregon. Here you can find festival maps & guides, drop off or find a lost item, set times, etc. Vendors: Vendor Village will feature local retail vendors offering a wide selection of items like clothing, accessories, craft items, tech products, and more. Festival and artist merchandise will also be located in the vendor village. FAQs WHAT ARE THE HOURS OF THE FESTIVAL? Friday, August 29, 2025 Gates Open – 12:00 pm – 11:30 pm Saturday, August 30, 2025 Gates Open – 12:00 pm – 11:30 pm Sunday, August 31, 2025 Gates Open – 12:00 pm – 11:00 pm When is the Festival Box Office Open? 2025 Box Office Hours Thursday, August 28th – 2:00 pm – 10:00 pm Friday, August 29th – 8:00 am – 10:00 pm Saturday, August 30th – 9:00 am – 10:00 pm Sunday, August 31st – 9:00 am – 10:00 pm The Box Office is located at the Northeast Entrance into the Festival Grounds, referred to as the Main Entrance on the Festival Map, adjacent to the Oregon State University Extension Service (Map Coordinates: 44.2379649,-121.1823944). There will be temporary parking available at the Festival Box Office. For any questions, wristband swaps, or to purchase any remaining wristbands, please see our amazing Box Office staff. WHAT IF IT RAINS, CAN I GET A REFUND? No, this festival is rain or shine! All Sales Final, No Refunds. WILL TICKET PRICES INCREASE? Yes, tickets will increase as inventory is sold through, and as we get closer to the festival dates. We always recommend purchasing in advance to save the most money. Tickets are also often SOLD OUT ahead of the festival, so lock in the good vibes now! WILL THERE BE FOOD & ALCOHOL AT THE FESTIVAL? Yes! A wide variety of food and beverage options will be featured throughout the festival grounds and campgrounds. From local food trucks to specialty vendors, there’s something for everyone, including vegan, vegetarian, and gluten-free options, plus several beer trailers along with full alcohol bars. WILL THERE BE ADA ACCOMMODATIONS? We want to provide an unforgettable experience for everybody at the Reggae Rise Up Oregon Festival. Additional questions please email Info@ReggaeRiseUp.com This event was designed to provide equal opportunity for enjoyment by all participants. Are pets or emotional support animals allowed in the festival? No, we do not allow pets or emotional support animals. However, registered service dogs are permitted to enter the event in accordance with ADA guidelines. If you need clarification on whether your dog qualifies as a service animal, please refer to the first section of the Service Animal FAQs on ADA.gov . To complete a Service Animal Registration Request, please notify Reggae Rise Up of your service animal’s attendance and your need for assistance during the festival. ARE WE ALLOWED TO BRING FOOD, WATER & ALCOHOL? There is no outside food or alcohol allowed into the festival, but you are able to bring in one (1) sealed water bottle up to 1L in size or an empty reusable personal water bottle. We will have plenty of food options from local vendors for you to choose from. We also have a FREE water refill station available. Please note that all items will be subject to search upon arrival. Food, water and alochol will be allowed in the Campgrounds – please refrain from bringing glass items. I’M A PHOTOGRAPHER. CAN I COME TAKE PICTURES? To apply for a media pass please click the “Get Involved” Tab and Select ” Media Application” when available. WHAT CAN I NOT BRING? Allowed Items List Blankets Chairs Regular-sized or unframed backpacks that will be searched upon entry Empty, refillable plastic or aluminum bottles, & Camelbak’s Sealed water up to 1L Binoculars Poster Tubes Diaper bags & strollers are allowed but will be searched thoroughly and must be used as intended Deodorant, Sunscreen & Non-Aerosol bug spray Hula Hoops Portable battery packs Personal misting fans with a bottle no larger than 1.5 L – must be empty upon entry Personal umbrellas only, anything larger than an umbrella that accommodates 2 people will not be allowed Personal prescription medicines with a matching name on verified ID Good Vibes *All items are subject to search and the Prohibited Items List is subject to change.* Prohibited Items List Outside food or beverage items Alcohol or flasks Cigarettes, tobacco or E-cigarettes – Deschutes County Fair & Expo Center is a tobacco-free and smoke-free facility. Ice or ice packs Coolers Glass containers Illegal substances, drugs, or drug paraphernalia Any items that are deemed unsafe or inappropriate, or are being used for purposes other than intended, may be confiscated on-site Illegal or unauthorized vending Knives or weapons of any kind Professional photo, video, or audio recording devices without prior approval Drones, UAVs, or UFOs Lasers or light pointers Animals or pets (except registered service animals that assist people with disabilities, please contact us in advance) Flammable lanterns or fire of any kind Fireworks or any types of explosives Skateboards, scooters or personalized motor vehicles Bicycles inside the festival grounds Tents or canopies Hammocks Frisbees or sports balls Wagons or carts of any type Chains, chain wallets, or spiked jewelry Instruments, megaphones, horns, or noisemakers Soliciting Pepper spray Spray paint, large markers Bad Vibes (Dad Vibes okay!) ARE WE ALLOWED TO BRING SOME FESTIVAL SPIRIT? 100%. Festival Totems, Flags, Signs, accepted and encouraged. CAN I BRING MY KIDS? Absolutely! We welcome families of all ages. Kids 6 and under are also free. Strollers for children are permitted but expect them to be searched. WHAT CAN I BRING TO SIT DOWN & STAY IN THE SHADE? Due to safety concerns, space, and viewing concerns, we kindly ask you to leave the tents and canopies at home. You CAN bring chairs and blankets along with small personal umbrellas. *We will have designated chair areas at each stage. No chairs or blankets in front of the sound/lighting booth (Front Of House). WILL THERE BE FIRST AID ON SITE? Of course, we have a dedicated medical tent with several professional EMT units to help when needed. WHERE CAN I FIND THE FLYER TO SHARE WITH FRIENDS? Visit us at any of our social media accounts FB : @ReggaeRiseUpOregon IG : @ReggaeRiseUp_Oregon TW : @ReggaeRiseUp TikTok : @ReggaeRiseUp RRU YouTube | RRU Spotify WILL THERE BE RE-ENTRY? Festival goers can exit and re-enter the festival grounds at any time, as long as they are wearing their valid wristband. You must scan your RFID Wristband in and out each time to authenticate. However, there is NO RE-ENTRY for vehicles leaving the campgrounds. In the case of an emergency, exits may be considered on a case-by-case basis by security or festival staff. WHERE CAN I FIND PERFORMANCE TIMES? 2025 Schedule Coming Soon. WHAT ACTIVITIES WILL BE HAPPENING DURING THE FESTIVAL? Music, Vendors, Games, Sports, Crafts, Art, Relaxation Stations, Fan Interactions, & More! WHEN DOES THE EVENT END EACH DAY? Music will end at 11:30 pm on Friday and Saturday. Music will end at 11 pm on Sunday. Please arrive early to experience all the amazing bands. WILL PARKING BE AVAILABLE? If you’re driving in for the day, there are two designated Day Parking lots located on the east side of the festival grounds. These lots are clearly marked on the map and are just a short walk to the Main Entrance. To access Day Parking, please follow all posted signage and staff directions as you approach the venue. Once parked, you’ll enter the festival on foot through the Main Entrance, which serves all ticket types. Day Parking lots will service both Day and Weekend Parking Passes. Please purchase your Parking Passes ahead of time to ensure a smooth entry. ADA Parking is located just east of the Main Entrance, adjacent to the festival grounds. Accessible paths and on-site assistance will be available to help you get inside quickly and safely. We recommend arriving early to avoid delays and to make the most of your festival weekend at Reggae Rise Up Oregon! HOW DO I REDEEM MY FOOD & BEVERAGE TOKENS? Each festival wristband, except for GA CORE ticketholders, comes pre-loaded with food and beverage redemption tokens based on your ticket type. These redemption tokens are stored on your wristband and can be scanned at all food and beverage vendors to redeem your meals. Each meal token has a $20 value and can be redeemed at any food vendor onsite or in the campground. Menu items can bundle up to a $20 value, however, any transaction over $20 will require the customer to pay the difference. Each beverage token includes any single mixed drink, beer, wine, or non-alcoholic beverage. ***Specialty cocktails not included*** Beverage Token inclusions vary by wristband type. (Platinum VIP,  VIP,  GA+,  GA) ***All GA CORE Ticket Types do NOT include Food or Beverage Redemption Tokens*** For a full list of Food Vendor options, visit our Vendor Lineup page. WHERE DO I PICK UP MY COMMEMORATIVE ITEMS? Your Festival Wristband is required for entry and securely holds all your commemorative items, food, and beverage tokens. Each ticket type includes a specific number of redemption tokens (Food, Beverage, etc.) to redeem. Simply scan your Festival Wristband at the designated ticket type redemption spots (Platinum VIP,  VIP, & GA+ Lounge Areas) to pick up your commemorative items. I WANT TO HELP VOLUNTEER DURING THE FESTIVAL, WHAT DO I DO? Fill out the form when you click Volunteers under the ‘Get Involved’ tab on the website. If you have more questions please email us at RRUStaffing@gmail.com for more details. I LOVE REGGAE AND WANT TO HELP PROMOTE BEFORE THE FESTIVAL, WHAT DO I DO? Please email us at Info@ReggaeRiseUp.com for more details. I NEED HELP WITH MY ORDER! WHO SHOULD I TALK TO? Please visit our Wristband Information page for all your wristband needs. SHARE YOUR STOKE Reggae Rise Up Florida • Arizona • Maryland • Oregon • Utah • Vegas • © Reggae Rise Up 2025. website by: Fighting Fifth Web

ENTRY CAN'S & CAN'TS Allowed Items Sealed water up to 1 liter Deodorant, Sunscreen & Non-Aersol bug spray Poster Tubes Hula hoops Registered Service Animals (Emotional Support Animals will NOT be permitted entry) Cigarettes and E-Cigarettes Good Vibes Prohibited Items Outside food or beverage Alcohol or Flasks Strollers, Wagons or Carts of any type Blankets, Chairs, Umbrellas, Tents or Canopies Backpacks, Purses, Bags larger than 14″ x 14″ Professional photo, video, or audio recording devices without prior approval Drones, UAVs, or UFOs Coolers, Ice or Ice packs Glass Containers Illegal substances, drugs, or drug paraphernalia Illegal or unauthorized vending Knives or weapons of any kind Animals or pets (except registered service animals that assist people with disabilities, please contact us in advance) Flammable lanterns or fire of any kind Fireworks or any types of explosives Skateboards, scooters or personalized motor vehicles Bicycles inside the festival grounds Lasers or light pointers Chains, chain wallets, or spiked jewelry Instruments, megaphones, horns, or noisemakers Soliciting Pepper spray Spray paint, large markers Bad Vibes (Dad vibes okay!) *All items are subject to search and these lists are subject to change* BOX OFFICE HOURS Thursday, October 2nd – 4:00 pm – 9:00 pm Friday, October 3rd – 11:00 am -­ 10:00 pm Saturday, October 4th – 11:00 am -­ 10:00 pm Sunday, October 5th –  11:00 am – 10:00 pm The box office will be located at: 298 E Carson Ave. Las Vegas, NV 89101 FACILITIES Medical: The Reggae Rise Up medical team will be on-site to address any type of medical problem you may have. The medical tent will be located in between the main festival grounds and vendor village. If you need assistance go to the medical tent, locate security or a festival staff member. Security: Our primary goal is to create a safe and secure environment for everyone in attendance. To ensure this, there will be on-site security provided by our private security staff and local police. If any problems occur whatsoever, locate a festival security guard, police officer or festival staff member. Food: Reggae Rise Up’s Vendor Village will offer a variety of food options from several local food trucks/vendors. We will have vegetarian/vegan options as well. Bars: For our 21+ attendees we will have several full bars spread out throughout the festival grounds, featuring your favorite brews and booze. Bathrooms & Handwashing Stations: Bathrooms and hand washing stations will be placed throughout the festival site. We ask that you help us in keeping them as clean as possible for the next festival attendee. Vendors: Vendor Village will feature local retail vendors offering a wide selection of items like clothing, accessories, craft items, tech products and more. Festival and artist merchandise will also be located in the vendor village. FAQS WHAT IF IT RAINS, CAN I GET A REFUND? No, this festival is rain or shine! No refunds. Are pets or emotional support animals allowed in the festival? No, we do not allow pets or emotional support animals. However, registered service dogs are permitted to enter the event in accordance with ADA guidelines. If you need clarification on whether your dog qualifies as a service animal, please refer to the first section of the Service Animal FAQs on ADA.gov . To complete a Service Animal Registration Request, please notify Reggae Rise Up of your service animal’s attendance and your need for assistance during the festival. Are We Allowed To Bring Food, Water, & Alcohol? There is no outside food or alcohol allowed into the festival, but you can bring in one (1) sealed water bottle up to 1L in size or an empty reusable personal water bottle. We will have plenty of food options from local vendors for you to choose from. We also have a FREE water refill station available. Please note that all items will be subject to search upon arrival. ARE WE ALLOWED TO BRING SOME FESTIVAL SPIRIT? 100%. Festival Totems, Flags, Signs, accepted and encouraged. CAN I BRING MY KIDS? Absolutely! We welcome families of all ages. Kids 6 and under are also free. Strollers for children are NOT permitted. WHERE CAN I FIND THE FLYER TO SHARE WITH FRIENDS? Visit us at any of our social media accounts. Facebook | Instagram | Twitter | TikTok WILL THERE BE RE-ENTRY? PLATINUM, VIP (3 Day & Single Day), & GA+ Tickets will be allowed 1 Re-Entry Per Day. GA Tickets will not be allowed re-entry. You must scan your RFID wristband out to be valid. WHERE CAN I FIND PERFORMANCE TIMES? Performance times will be released closer to festival weekend. Stay tuned! I NEED HELP WITH MY ORDER! WHO SHOULD I TALK TO? If you purchased your tickets through Tixr and need order support, or did not update your mailing address on time and need to request replacement wristbands to be picked up at the Festival Box Office, please contact support@tixr.com . *All wristbands from an order are associated with the name of the order purchaser* SHARE YOUR STOKE Reggae Rise Up Florida • Arizona • Maryland • Oregon • Utah • Vegas • © Reggae Rise Up 2025. website by: Fighting Fifth Web

There is no outside food or alcohol allowed into the festival, but you are able to bring in one (1) sealed water bottle up to 1L in size or an empty reusable personal water bottle. We will have plenty of food options from local vendors for you to choose from. We also have a FREE water refill station available. Please note that all items will be subject to search upon arrival. I’M A PHOTOGRAPHER. CAN I COME TAKE PICTURES? To apply for a media pass please click the “Get Involved” Tab and Select “Media Application” when available. WHAT CAN I NOT BRING? Allowed Items List Blankets, Chairs, and SMALL personal umbrellas are allowed in designated areas. Small Clutch Bags and Fanny Packs with a single zipper opening and measuring 6.5″ x 4.5″ or smaller are permitted without being clear. Larger bags (than those mentioned above) MUST be clear and cannot exceed 11″ x 6″ x 12″ in size. Clear 1 Gallon Resealable Plastic Storage Bags. Empty, refillable plastic or aluminum bottles, & Camelbak’s. Sealed water up to 1L. Binoculars. Poster Tubes. Strollers actively used for childcare. Cigarettes and E-Cigarettes. Deodorant, Sunscreen & Non-Aerosol bug spray. Hula Hoops. Good Vibes. *All items are subject to search and the Prohibited Items List is subject to change.* Prohibited Items List Outside food or beverage items. Alcohol or Flasks. Ice or Ice packs. Coolers. Glass Containers. Illegal substances, drugs, or drug paraphernalia. Any of these items that are deemed unsafe or inappropriate, or are being used for purposes other than intended, may be confiscated on-site. Illegal or unauthorized vending. Knives or weapons of any kind. Professional photo, video, or audio recording devices without prior approval. Drones, UAVs, or UFOs. Lasers or light pointers. Animals or pets (except registered service animals that assist people with disabilities, please contact us in advance). Flammable lanterns or fire of any kind. Fireworks or any types of explosives. Skateboards, scooters or personalize motor vehicles. Bicycles inside the festival grounds. Tents, Canopies, or Large Shade Structures. SMALL Personal Umbrellas are allowed in designated areas. Wagons or carts of any type used to transport goods or belongings. Strollers with children are okay. Chains, chain wallets, or spiked jewelry. Instruments, megaphones, horns, or noisemakers. Soliciting. Pepper spray. Spray paint, large markers. Bad Vibes (Dad Vibes okay!) ARE WE ALLOWED TO BRING SOME FESTIVAL SPIRIT? 100%. Festival Totems, Flags, Signs, accepted and encouraged. CAN I BRING MY KIDS? Absolutely! We welcome families of all ages. Kids 6 and under are also free. Strollers for children are permitted but expect them to be searched. WHAT CAN I BRING TO SIT DOWN & STAY IN THE SHADE? Due to safety concerns, space, and viewing concerns, we kindly ask you to leave the tents and canopies at home. You CAN bring chairs, blankets, and SMALL personal umbrellas to use in designated areas. *We will have designated chair areas at each stage. No chairs or blankets in front of the sound/lighting booth (Front Of House). WILL THERE BE FIRST AID ON SITE? Of course, we have a dedicated medical tent with several professional EMT units to help when needed. WHERE CAN I FIND THE FLYER TO SHARE WITH FRIENDS? Visit us at any of our social media accounts FB : @ReggaeRiseUpArizona IG : @ReggaeRiseUp_Arizona TW : @ReggaeRiseUp TikTok : @ReggaeRiseUp RRU YouTube | RRU Spotify WILL THERE BE RE-ENTRY? PLATINUM, VIP (3 Day & Single Day), & GA+ Tickets will be allowed 1 Re-Entry Per Day. GA Tickets will not be allowed re-entry. You must scan your RFID wristband out to be valid. 2026 Festival Hours Coming Soon. WHERE CAN I FIND PERFORMANCE TIMES? 2026 Festival Performance Schedule Coming Soon WHAT ACTIVITIES WILL BE HAPPENING DURING THE FESTIVAL? Music, Vendors, Games, Sports, Crafts, Art, Relaxation Stations, Fan Interactions and more! WHEN DOES THE EVENT END EACH DAY? Music ends at 11 PM Friday and Saturday, and 10 PM on Sunday. Please arrive early to experience all the amazing bands. …But the party never stops in Tempe! Stay tuned for Afterparty Info closer to the Festival Dates. ARE THERE ANY TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS OTHER THAN RIDESHARE? The Tempe Streetcar is a $1 per ride transportation along 3 mile route throughout Downtown Tempe. The Streetcar has a stop at Tempe Beach Park and runs Monday – Sunday from 8AM to 12AM. More info at valleymetro.org/streetcar . I WANT TO HELP VOLUNTEER DURING THE FESTIVAL, WHAT DO I DO? Fill out the form when you click Volunteers under the ‘Get Involved’ tab on the website. If you have more questions please email us at RRUStaffing@gmail.com for more details. I LOVE REGGAE AND WANT TO HELP PROMOTE BEFORE THE FESTIVAL, WHAT DO I DO? Please email us at Info@ReggaeRiseUp.com for more details. I NEED HELP WITH MY ORDER! WHO SHOULD I TALK TO? 2026 Wristband Information Coming Soon SHARE YOUR STOKE Reggae Rise Up Florida • Arizona • Maryland • Oregon • Utah • Vegas • © Reggae Rise Up 2025. website by: Fighting Fifth Web

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS How much does it cost to create an estate plan? We offer transparent pricing and flat-fee packages that include trust creation, wills, and asset protection—no surprises. What’s included in a free consultation? We’ll learn about your goals, map out your needs, and recommend a custom plan. No pressure and clear next steps. Can you help update an old will or trust? Absolutely. Whether you need a simple update or a full plan review, we’re here to make it right. Our process will make sure any outdated documents are replaced with current, legally sound, and comprehensive documents to match the changes needed. What if we have an emergency need for a will or trust? We are here to support you through the ups and downs of life. We can expedite document preparation and visit you where you are to get everything executed.
